reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Supercharged Home Networking Experience
reviews.reviewText: The Linksys EA8300 Max-Stream AC2200 Tri-Band Wi-Fi Router has taken my home networking experience to a new level. The tri-band technology ensures a robust and stable connection across all my devices, and the AC2200 speed is more than sufficient for streaming, gaming, and heavy data transfers. The setup was straightforward, and the router's user interface was intuitive, allowing easy management of my home network. With a seamless roaming feature, I can move around my home without losing connection, which is a big plus. Overall, this router offers exceptional value for its price and is a fantastic choice for anyone looking to upgrade their home wireless network.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy Set-Up and Does What is Advertised
reviews.reviewText: Quality design and build. Does not run hot. Looks like something out of a sci-fi show with the design and the four movable antennae. Simplest set-up I have ever completed for a router. Took it out of the box, read the quick startup card. Logged onto the Linksys site as directed. Then plugged in the router to the outlet and the modem. Logged into the site as directed and set up the network and the router's password. Also, I set up another account that lets me access the home network remotely.I noticed how easily understandable and clear the directions for everything are. The router having a separate password and settings allowing for automatic updates is helpful. Can set up parental controls and can also set up all three bands separately with each having its own log-ins. The guest network is also nice.I was impressed by the strength of the signal in a 3700 square feet, two-story house with a full basement. It was five bars to the first floor from the router location on the second floor at the south end of the house, four bars to the deck and yard outside, and three bars to the basement Previously, the speed of the old router was 3 bars to the first floor and 1-2 in the basement and 2 outside on the deck. Also, ran some tests for performance (I am not an IT guy) but the results surpassed my old router.Also, just for our own purposes, we tried to overload the system, so we had three computers, three cell phones (playing music on two and one messaging), and two TVs (one streaming Netflix and the other Hulu). There was no drop off of any device and no buffering delays. I assume this is due to the router being able to manage the devices and the individual data needs, but all I know is it worked. I was worried about needing an extender, but at this point am satisfied with the results.I gave this five stars based upon the quality of the router build, the ease of and flexibility of set-up, the features, and the performance-based upon less than a day of usage. I will provide an additional review down the road and if everything is still working flawlessly (or nearly so), will be happy to re-affirm the 5 stars then.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice router with advanced features
reviews.reviewText: Nice router. Pretty easy to set up if you follow the quick-start instructions. There was a moment when it said it couldn't connect to the router and that I should press the reset button on back. Once I did that, it found it and set up fine. The nice thing about it is that it doesn't have the super bright blinky lights on it that some routers have. Just a glowing Linksys light on top that indicates status based on whether it's on steady, or slowing flashing. You can get all the other status you need simply by logging into your mylinksyssmartwifi account, which connects to the router. The admin panel is far more sophisticated that my old router. You can do so much more, like set up guest accounts, prioritize certain devices over others (like streaming devices, for example), give different names and passwords to the 2.4Gghz and 5Ghz routers that are built into this, look at a graphical map of all connected devices, parental controls, and so much more. I gave it the same name and password as my old router, so devices like cell phones, Roku, wireless camera, wireless thermostat, iPads, etc, were all able connect without re-doing their setup. I did have to change the routers security setting to WPA2 Personal, instead of WPA2/WPA Mixed, in order to get my iPads to connect. Overall, seems like a great device at a great price. ******UPDATE: After using this router for a few days, I noticed that my internet speed is down to 1.5Mbps download / .89Mbps upload. Reconnecting my old router again, I get 3.5M download and .93M upload. So the download has dropped by half on this new router, while the upload is about the same. I've tried the swap a couple of times and verified this. I've also restarted both my cable modem and the Linksys router a few times to no avail. For now, I've taken this new router out of service and installed my old one again. I'm going to have to return it if I can't resolve this. *****SECOND UPDATE: I did some online research and got some advice from Amazon buyers, and learned that it was the "Media Prioritization" that was causing the slowdown. I had to go into Media Prioritization, then Settings, and then adjust the Downstream Bandwidth up to 4500kbps (my max. download speed on my Comcast plan is 3500kbps, so 4500 is more than enough to set it to. You may need to set it higher if you get faster internet speeds). By default, it was set to 1500kbps, except for the Roku devices that I had added to the priority list. I hadn't realized that by turning on Media Prioritization, it would throttle all other internet access down to 1500kpbs, except for the priority items. So you can either just turn M.P. off, or leave it on and raise the Downstream Bandwidth number.

reviews.reviewTitle: Internet estable y red interna mas veloz
reviews.reviewText: Mejoró la conectividad de mi red interna, y se percibe un internet más estable, esto debido a que puede atender peticiones simultáneas de varios dispositivos por el arreglo MIMO.La conexión con mi disco duro a travez de la red mejoro mucho, pase de 50 Mbps (router del proveedor) a 500 Mbps al respaldar archivos.cabe mencionar que solo tengo activa la red 5g y lo puse en modo bridge, ya que tengo otro dispositivo que me brinda el DHCP
Buen alcance de señal, fácil configuración
Acredite em quem tem experiencia de mais de 30 anos com roteadores - vai surpreender suas expectativas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Buen producto con muy buena tecnología.
reviews.reviewText: La buena distribución de señal de dos bandas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Un producto muy bueno. He comprado dos de estos y los dos han funcionado perfectamente.
reviews.reviewText: Puntos a favor:- En lo personal este es mi segundo router de este modelo que compro y no he tenido problema con ambos.- En ambas casas he hecho pruebas de conectividad, alcanse de la señal y se maneja muy bien.- En una de las casa lo tengo trabajando con un enlace de fibra óptica de 80 MB y sin problema está atendiendo aproximadamente 25 dispositivos entre celulares, tablets, TV, consolas de videojuegos jugando en línea.- Incluso mientras realizo Streem desde el PlayStation y en ningún momento decae el rendimiento ni el servicio de internet.- En la otra casa lo tengo con un enlace de fibra óptica de 60 MB atendiendo aproximadamente 10 dispositivos mientra reproduzco contenido en 4K sin problema.- Corrigió las desconexiones y resolución pobre que tenía el modem de mi operador.- Después de probar varios otros modelos fue el único que me funciono como esperaba y un poco más, incluso probé routers especializados para Gaming pero este los supera por mucho.Puntos en contra:- El único punto en contra es que cuando juntas las dos redes de 5 GHz y la de 2 GHz no te da opción a seleccionar el canal por los que quieres usar la señal.
